detail.content: AlumniDramatistGuildFellows: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Graduate Musical Theatre Writing About the Program Course Offerings News & Events Summer Alumni Admin & Faculty Newsletter Facebook Twitter YouTube  home > Graduate Musical Theatre Writing        GMTWP Alumni Selected as Dramatists Guild Fellows   Julianne Wick Davis, Dan Collins, Lori Mannette, Joel Waggoner, and Rob Shapiro were all selected as 2012 Dramatist Guild Fellows.       The Dramatist Guild Fellowship Program was designed to augment the training of emerging American Dramatists and enhance the sense of community among them. Twice a month the Fellows meet with program advisors Lynn Ahrens, Stephen Flaherty, Susan Miller and Janet Neipris, and program director Andrea Lepico to present their work and discuss it with professionals as well as peers. Award-winning playwrights, musical theatre writers, directors, artistic directors, choreographers, and orchestrators are often invited to share and discuss their experiences with the Fellows. Guest writers also meet with the Fellows for one-on-one mentoring, and the Dramatist Guild arranges for internships on Broadway and off-Broadway productions. Selected among this years’ fellows are Julianne Wick Davis, Dan Collins (Cycle 16), Lori Mannette, Joel Waggoner (Cycle 19) and Rob Shapiro (Cycle 16).
